Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Cutters to Prepare Sheets of Paper
Description: The ancient Egyptians were among the first people to know writing. They started to use hieroglyphic signs at the beginning of the historic period that began around 3000 BC. Their success in making paper from papyrus meant that numerous items were needed to prepare the sheets of paper including these cutters. The cutters, which have razor-sharp edges, were made of flint.
